intro: Catunaregam, commonly known as the Indian balsam, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Gesneriaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South and Southeast Asia, including India, Indonesia, and Malaysia. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of red, orange, and yellow. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant blooms and compact growth habit. Catunaregam thrives in moist, well-drained soil and requires partial to full sunlight for optimal growth.
